original: 7. Cetiyapāṭihāriyapañha
analyzed: cetiya pāṭihāriya pañha
translated: The Chapter on Vessantara🔽The Questions of the Miracle of the Shrine

original: “Bhante nāgasena, sabbesaṁ parinibbutānaṁ cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti, udāhu ekaccānaṁyeva hotī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena sabbesam parinibbutānam cetiye pāṭihīram hoti udāhu ekacca anayā iva hoti iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, is there a miracle of a shrine for all who have attained Nibbāna, or is there for some only?”

original: “Ekaccānaṁ, mahārāja, hoti, ekaccānaṁ na hotī”ti.
analyzed: ekaccāna mahā rāja hoti ekaccānam na hoti iti
translated: “For some there is, sire, and for some there is not.”

original: “Katamesaṁ, bhante, hoti, katamesaṁ na hotī”ti?
analyzed: katamesam bhante hoti katamesam na hoti iti
translated: “For which, revered sir, is there and for which is there not?”

original: “Tiṇṇannaṁ, mahārāja, aññatarassa adhiṭṭhānā parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti.
analyzed: mahārāja aññatarassa adhiṭṭhānā parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīram hoti
translated: “For three, sire, there is a miracle of a shrine by reason of their resolve.

original: Katamesaṁ tiṇṇannaṁ?
analyzed: katamesam tiṇṇat na
translated: For which three?

original: Idha, mahārāja, arahā devamanussānaṁ anukampāya tiṭṭhantova adhiṭṭhāti ‘evaṁnāma🔽cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hotū’ti, tassa adhiṭṭhānavasena cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti, evaṁ arahato
analyzed: idha mahā rāja arahā deva manussānam anukampāya tiṭṭhantaḥ iva adhiṭṭhāti eva nāma  cetiye pāṭihīram hotu uti tassa adhiṭṭhāna vasena cetiye pāṭihīram hoti evam arahato
translated: Here, sire, a perfected one, out of compassion for gods and men, standing even as he is resolves: ‘Let there be a miracle of a shrine at such and such a place named so and so.’

original: adhiṭṭhānavasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti.
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna vasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīram hoti
translated: And by reason of his resolve there is a miracle of a shrine. Thus, sire, there is a miracle of a shrine for a perfected one by reason of his resolve.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, devatā manussānaṁ anukampāya parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja devatāḥ manussānaṃ anukampāya parinibbutassa cetiye
translated: Again, sire, a god out of compassion for men, by reason of his resolve,

original: dassenti ‘iminā pāṭihīrena saddhammo niccasampaggahito bhavissati, manussā ca pasannā
analyzed: dassenti iminā pāṭihīrena saddhammaḥ nicca sampaggahitaḥ bhavissati manussā ca pasannā
translated: ‘By this miracle the true Dhamma will be well-established, and people will be pleased,

original: kusalena abhivaḍḍhissantī’ti, evaṁ devatānaṁ adhiṭṭhānavasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti.
analyzed: kusalena abhivaḍḍhissanti iti evam devatānam adhiṭṭhāna vasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīram hoti
translated: ‘By this miracle the True Dhamma will be constantly upheld and men will be happy and will increase in merit.’ Thus a miracle occurs at the monument of one who has attained final Nibbāna by the power of the deities.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, itthī vā puriso vā saddho pasanno paṇḍito byatto medhāvī
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja itthī vā purisaḥ vā saddhaḥ pasannaḥ paṇḍitaḥ byattaḥ medhāvī
translated: “Again, sire, a woman or a man who is faithful, confident, wise, prudent, intelligent,

original: buddhisampanno yoniso cintayitvā gandhaṁ vā mālaṁ vā dussaṁ vā aññataraṁ vā kiñci🔽adhiṭṭhahitvā cetiye ukkhipati ‘evaṁnāma hotū’ti, tassapi adhiṭṭhānavasena parinibbutassa
analyzed: buddhi sampannaḥ yonisas cintayitvā gandham vā mālam vā dussam vā aññataram vā kiñci  adhiṭṭhahitvā cetiye ukkhipati evanāma hotu uti tassa api adhiṭṭhāna vasena parinibbutassa
translated: having reflected wisely, having made up his or her mind, offers perfume, a garland, a cloth or some other object

original: cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti, evaṁ manussānaṁ adhiṭṭhānavasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti.
analyzed: cetiye pāṭihīram hoti evam manussānam adhiṭṭhāna vasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīram hoti
translated: and dedicates it to the monument, saying: ‘Let it be such and such.’ Thus a miracle occurs at the monument of one who has attained final Nibbāna by the power of the dedication. Thus a miracle occurs at the monument of one who has attained final Nibbāna by the power of men.

original: Imesaṁ kho, mahārāja, tiṇṇannaṁ aññatarassa adhiṭṭhānavasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīraṁ hoti.
analyzed: imesam kho mahā rāja tiṇṇannam aññatarassa adhiṭṭhāna vasena parinibbutassa cetiye pāṭihīram hoti
translated: “These, sire, are the three by the power of which a miracle occurs at the monument of one who has attained final Nibbāna.”🔽“Revered Nāgasena, it is said, ‘a miracle, a miracle.’ What is a miracle?”

original: Yadi, mahārāja, tesaṁ adhiṭṭhānaṁ na hoti, khīṇāsavassapi chaḷabhiññassa cetovasippattassa
analyzed: yadi mahā rāja tesam adhiṭṭhānam na hoti khīṇāsavassa api chaḍabhiññassa cetovasippattassa
translated: If, sire, they do not make their resolve, then even though one be a person of great spiritual power, one who has destroyed the cankers, who has the six psychic powers,

original: cetiye pāṭihīraṁ na hoti, asatipi, mahārāja, pāṭihīre caritaṁ disvā suparisuddhaṁ
analyzed: cetiye pāṭihīram na mahā rāja pāṭihīre caritam disvā su parisuddha
translated: and if there is no miracle at the shrine, then, sire, even though there is no miracle, if one sees the conduct of the person who has passed away to be pure,

original: okappetabbaṁ niṭṭhaṁ gantabbaṁ saddahitabbaṁ ‘suparinibbuto ayaṁ buddhaputto’”ti.
analyzed: okappetabbam niṭṭham gantabbam saddahitabbam su parinibbutaḥ ayam buddha putto ti
translated: one should conclude that he has attained complete extinction.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena, so it is, therefore do I accept it.”

original: Cetiyapāṭihāriyapañho sattamo.
analyzed: cetiya pāṭihāriya pañho sattamaḥ
translated: Question seven: the miracle at the shrine.
